content.description:
Climb the hand/fist crack past a low horn and a pinch flake on the left edge of the crack. Head left through the crux to a ledge and dihedral above. Gear anchor.

At the left end of the wall find a spruce tree next to a large boulder. In front of the tree are ttwo crack that meet at a ledge above. This route climbs the left trending hand & fist crack on the right.
Bring hand & fist sized gear. Gear anchor. Save a #2 or #3 for anchor.

Climb flakes & hand crack to the crux bulge near top. Pumpy to start. Great quality rock. Rap rings installed July 2019.

At the right end of wall. Climbs the hand crack in a slightly overhung dihedral with small flakes. Stand on block/ledge to start.
#0.5 - #2, rings at top.

Climbs a right leaning finger crack to a ledge and easy dihedral above. Thin crux near bottom with limited gear placements. As you climb the holds and protection improve. Gear anchor.

At the left end of the wall find a spruce tree beside a large boulder. In front of the tree are two cracks that join at a ledge above. This route climbs the right leaning finger crack on the left side.
Takes small cams (#0.1 or #0.2 - 0.4) before ledge, large cams after (#2-3). Gear anchor (#1-#3)

Sustained climbing on a vertical wall. Jam the hand/fist crack to a bulge near the top (crux) and a set of rap rings that follow.

In the centre of the wall. Obvious crack starts above a square block wedged in a tiny, hobbit-sized cave.
Takes #0.5-#2. Rap rings for anchor.

This short, granite dome can be found at the western edge of Whale Cove Lake in Terence Bay. With walls on three sides, the lakeside face features prominent vertical cracks while the others have scattered low & high ball boulder problems.

-Trad climbs enter the shade around noon, making summer climbing cool.

-More secluded than Crow's Nest making windy days comfortable (and bug season wretched!)

-Easy access trail to the top of cliff (right of 'El Tostador') makes retrieving a gear anchor or setting up a top rope a simple process.

-Great view of Whale Cove Lake and surrounding crags.

-Natural fridge at the base of 'La Nevera' keeps 'cold ones' cold.

-No crowds :)
